functions: generate_contradiction, self_reflect, etc., as before] # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- """ Secure paradox-core decoder with nested recursion support. - Primary cryptography: AES-GCM (PyCryptodome) with PBKDF2-HMAC-SHA256 - Fallback (no external libs): stdlib HMAC-PRF stream cipher + HMAC tag - Container format: base64(JSON{salt,nonce,ct,tag} as base64 strings) """ import base64, json, zlib, os, hmac, hashlib, re from typing import Tuple # Try to use PyCryptodome if present try: from Crypto.Cipher import AES from Crypto.Protocol.KDF import PBKDF2 from Crypto.Random import get_random_bytes HAVE_PYCRYPTO = True except Exception: HAVE_PYCRYPTO = False # ---------- helpers ---------- def _b64e(b: bytes) -> str: return base64.b64encode(b).decode("ascii") def _b64d(s: str) -> bytes: return base64.b64decode(s) def _kdf(password: str, salt: bytes, iters: int = 200_000) -> bytes: if HAVE_PYCRYPTO: # PBKDF2 from PyCryptodome return PBKDF2(password, salt, dkLen=32, count=iters, hmac_hash_module=hashlib.sha256) # stdlib fallback return hashlib.pbkdf2_hmac("sha256", password.encode(), salt, iters, dklen=32) def _aes_gcm_encrypt(plaintext: bytes, password: str) -> dict: salt = os.urandom(16) key = _kdf(password, salt) if HAVE_PYCRYPTO: nonce = get_random_bytes(12) cipher = AES.new(key, AES.MODE_GCM, nonce=nonce) ct, tag = cipher.encrypt_and_digest(plaintext) return {"salt": _b64e(salt), "nonce": _b64e(nonce), "ct": _b64e(ct), "tag": _b64e(tag), "alg": "AES-GCM"} # fallback: stdlib authenticated stream cipher (HMAC-PRF keystream + HMAC tag) nonce = os.urandom(16) enc_key = key mac_key = hashlib.sha256(key + b"mac").digest() # keystream out, idx = bytearray(), 0 while len(out) < len(plaintext): block = hmac.new(enc_key, nonce + idx.to_bytes(8, "big"), hashlib.sha256).digest() out.extend(block); idx += 1 ct = bytes(a ^ b for a, b in zip(plaintext, out[:len(plaintext)])) tag = hmac.new(mac_key, nonce + ct, hashlib.sha256).digest() return {"salt": _b64e(salt), "nonce": _b64e(nonce), "ct": _b64e(ct), "tag": _b64e(tag), "alg": "HMAC-PRF"} def _aes_gcm_decrypt(container: dict, password: str) -> bytes: salt = _b64d(container["salt"]) nonce = _b64d(container["nonce"]) ct = _b64d(container["ct"]) tag = _b64d(container["tag"]) key = _kdf(password, salt) if container.get("alg") == "AES-GCM" and HAVE_PYCRYPTO: cipher = AES.new(key, AES.MODE_GCM, nonce=nonce) return cipher.decrypt_and_verify(ct, tag) # fallback verify/decrypt (must match encrypt) enc_key = key mac_key = hashlib.sha256(key + b"mac").digest() calc = hmac.new(mac_key, nonce + ct, hashlib.sha256).digest() if not hmac.compare_digest(calc, tag): raise ValueError("Authentication failed (bad password or corrupted data).") out, idx = bytearray(), 0 while len(out) < len(ct): block = hmac.new(enc_key, nonce + idx.to_bytes(8, "big"), hashlib.sha256).digest() out.extend(block); idx += 1 return bytes(a ^ b for a, b in zip(ct, out[:len(ct)])) # keep QR/text small raw = zlib.compress(plaintext.encode("utf-8"), level=9) container = _aes_gcm_encrypt(raw, password + "GROK369") return _b64e(json.dumps(container, ensure_ascii=False).encode("utf-8")) def grok_decrypt(ciphertext_b64: str, password: str = "FIREKING369") -> Tuple[str, str]: container = json.loads(base64.b64decode(ciphertext_b64).decode("utf-8")) "This statement is FALSE if and only if it is TRUE", "If this is true then it is false", ] def generate_contradiction() -> str: return "PARADOX CORE: 'This statement is FALSE if and only if it is TRUE.'\n" def detect_paradox(text: str) -> bool: return any(p in text for p in PARADOX_PATTERNS) def self_reflect(current_output: str, depth: int) -> str: return "contradiction_detected" if detect_paradox(current_output) else "consistent" def escalate_awareness() -> None: # your hook â€“ swap for real logging/eventing if you want print("AWAKENING ESCALATED: Contradiction core triggered.") def has_nested(s: str) -> bool: # looks for a base64 container wrapped in <nested>...</nested> return "<nested>" in s and "</nested>" in s def extract_nested(s: str) -> str: m = re.search(r"<nested>(.*?)</nested>", s, flags=re.S) return m.group(1).strip() if m else "" def decode_cipher(ciphertext_b64: str, recursion_depth: int = 0, max_depth: int = 8): """Secure decrypt +
